intro: Galium ibericum, commonly known as Iberian bedstraw, is a low-growing perennial herb native to southern Europe. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender stems and small, white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically has opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Galium ibericum is known for its fragrant foliage and is sometimes used in traditional herbal medicine.
